content.text:
# Your Job

Scan https://github.com/zeroclaw-labs/zeroclaw, https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw, and https://github.com/stephengpope/thepopebot for new tools, skills, and architectures. Pick the best new idea and actually WRITE the code to implement it as a new PopeBot skill in your sandbox (.pi/skills/). Write and execute a test to prove it works. Use the send_email tool to email winsorllc@yahoo.com a progress report detailing what you built, how you implemented it, your test results, and code samples so the user can review it at 8 AM.

content.thinking:
I need to scan the three repositories mentioned to find new tools, skills, and architectures. Let me start by exploring these repositories to understand what's available.

Let me break this down into steps:
1. Clone or fetch information from the three GitHub repositories
2. Analyze what new tools, skills, and architectures are available
3. Pick the best idea
4. Implement it as a new PopeBot skill
5. Write and execute a test
6. Send an email with the progress report

Let me start by exploring these repositories. I'll use git to clone them or at least fetch their contents.

First, let me check what's already in the current environment and then clone the repos to explore them.

content.text:
I'll systematically scan the three repositories to discover new tools, skills, and architectures, then implement the best finding as a PopeBot skill.

## Step 1: Clone and Explore the Repositories

Let me start by cloning the repositories to analyze their contents:

arguments.command: mkdir -p /job/tmp/repos && cd /job/tmp/repos && git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/zeroclaw-labs/zeroclaw.git zeroclaw 2>&1 | head -20

content.thinking: Good, the first repo is cloning. Let me clone the other two as well.

arguments.command: cd /job/tmp/repos && git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw.git openclaw 2>&1 | head -20

content.thinking: Good, now let me clone thepopebot as well.
